post_text:
Due to the inclement weather forecast for later on, all afternoon and evening activities are canceled for today, December 2nd. This includes the Lego Primetime Camp scheduled at Village School. The regular Primetime Programs at Village and Indian Hill will remain open until their usual closing time.

Please note that we may also experience transportation delays. In the event of any substantial bus delays, we will alert the families of students on each bus route impacted. Thank you for your patience.

post_text:
Because of the continued power outage at Village School, all Summer Programs held there are canceled for today, July 24th. This includes our district Extended School Year program as well as the Township's Summer Recreation program. Please note that the Recreation Department has asked that we share that the Recreation Department trip scheduled for today will go on as planned.

Thank you -

Robert A. McGarry, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

Unfortunately, the High School and Satz Complex is still without power and JCP&L is unclear about when it will return. Therefore, those schools will be closed today. Village and Indian Hill School will open on a Delayed Opening Schedule.

Robert McGarry, Ed.D.

Good evening.

Due to current predictions and the estimated time needed to clear roads, parking areas and walkways, we have decided to call for a Delayed Opening for Monday, March 4th. Please see Delayed Opening Schedules here. https://bit.ly/2HuCqWv Please know that we will continue to monitor conditions throughout the night. In the event of any additional change in schedule for Monday, March 4th we will utilize our phone system, website, and social media to alert the community.

Be safe -

Robert A. McGarry, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

post_text:
Good evening.

Upon reviewing the most recent weather forecast, I have decided that for the safety of our students and staff, we will implement an Early Dismissal (4 hour session day) schedule tomorrow, February 20th. This is the same schedule as the 4-hour day we just had on Friday. You can review that schedule on our website.

Due to the timing of the storm, all after school and evening activities and the after school portion of the Prime Time program are canceled as well.

Thank you -

Robert A. McGarry, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

post_text: The Holmdel School District is issuing this clarification regarding a news story that is circulating today about a recent arrest in Holmdel and the misleading headlines several publications have given to articles and postings. The person who was arrested was a Superintendent in another school district. The individual was not the Superintendent of the Holmdel School District. Please be guided accordingly in any reporting of this matter.

Please be guided accordingly in any reporting of this matter.

post_text: JCP&L is reporting that over 2,700 customers in Holmdel are without power. This includes Village Elementary School and the Satz-HS Complex. Reports of the estimated time for restoration are varied, and as such, I will provide a message by 5:30 a.m. as to the status of power in our schools and our plan for the morning.

Robert A. McGarry, Ed.D.

post_text:
While I had hoped the timing of today's storm would have allowed us to get into school and use an early dismissal, after close consideration of the latest forecast it does not seem that we will be able to safely do that. As such, the Holmdel Schools will be closed today, March 21st. This latest closure marks our fifth Emergency Closure, which unfortunately means that both Thursday, April 5th and Friday, April 6th will be makeup school days.

Please be safe today -

Robert A. McGarry, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

post_text:
Thanks to the fantastic efforts of our district's Buildings and Grounds staff and the Holmdel Township Department of Public Works, our school district will open on time tomorrow, Friday, February 10th.

Given the expected drop in temperature overnight and into the morning, and the potential for drifts and icy spots, I am asking that parents consider having student drivers take the bus tomorrow and that we all take the advice found on our township website under snow removal, which states, "A good rule of thumb is to drive half of the posted speed or less, depending on the condition."

Thank you -

Dr. Robert McGarry, Superintendent
text:
Thanks to the fantastic efforts of our district's Buildings and Grounds staff and the Holmdel Township Department of Public Works, our school district will open on time tomorrow, Friday, February 10th.

Given the expected drop in temperature overnight and into the morning, and the potential for drifts and icy spots, I am asking that parents consider having student drivers take the bus tomorrow and that we all take the advice found on our township website under snow removal, which states, "A good rule of thumb is to drive half of the posted speed or less, depending on the condition."

Thank you -

Dr. Robert McGarry, Superintendent

post_text:
With weather conditions forecast to deteriorate over the course of the day and into the evening, the following cancellations will be in effect:

Village and Indian Hill School: All after-school and evening activities are cancelled. The daily Prime Time program will remain open, but we are asking parents to make efforts to pick up children as soon as possible after regular dismissal. "Camps" scheduled for today (Thread Heads, Coding and Soccer) are cancelled.

W.R. Satz and Holmdel High School: Buildings will close at the departure of the late buses at 4:15. All activities scheduled after that are cancelled.

post_text:
Dear All:

All are safe!

I received notice at 12:37 a.m. that the Holmdel Police Department had received a suspicious phone call regarding Village School. Joe Scala, Director of Plant, Operations and Maintenance, met the Police at Village and the school was searched thoroughly. Police finished the search and declared the school safe. Police officers will continue to provide surveillance.

Thank you
Barbara Duncan,
Superintendent
text:
Dear All:

All are safe!

I received notice at 12:37 a.m. that the Holmdel Police Department had received a suspicious phone call regarding Village School. Joe Scala, Director of Plant, Operations and Maintenance, met the Police at Village and the school was searched thoroughly. Police finished the search and declared the school safe. Police officers will continue to provide surveillance.

Thank you
Barbara Duncan,
Superintendent

post_text:
Dear All:

There was a phone call of a possible threat to Village. The school immediately went into Shelter in Place. The Holmdel Police Department checked the entire building and declared it safe form any danger. No further action was deemed necessary and all activies haved resumed. All are safe.

Thank you to the Holmdel Police Department for their immediate assistance and direction.

Sincerely,
Barbara Duncan

post_text: The "Shelter in Place" status for William R. Satz School and Holmdel High School. All schools have returned to normal daily operations. The police will continue to monitor all schools throughout the day.
text: The "Shelter in Place" status for William R. Satz School and Holmdel High School. All schools have returned to normal daily operations. The police will continue to monitor all schools throughout the day.

post_text:
At this time the Holmdel Police Department have canceled the "Secure the Building" status for Village, and Indian Hill Schools. These schools have returned to normal daily operations.
The Satz/High School complex remains in “Shelter in Place” status. We will continue to update you as we receive more information.
The police will continue to monitor all schools throughout the day.
Thank you.
Barbara Duncan
Superintendent
text:

post_text:
There was a suspicious phone call received this morning at William R. Satz School. As a result, the Satz/High School complex has been placed in "Shelter in Place," which means that no one may enter or exit these schools until the police have given clearance to resume to normal operations. All are safe.
Village and Indian Hill Schools have been placed in “Secure the Building.” As such, no one may enter or exit these schools either. We will keep you informed as the police conduct their work. Please do not attempt to come to the schools at this time.
For more information on various emergency procedures please click here.

Thank you.
Barbara Duncan

There was a suspicious phone call received this morning at Village School. As a result, all of our buildings have been placed in "Shelter in Place," which means that no one may enter or exit any building until the police have given clearance to resume to normal operations. All are safe.

The police have been on the scene at Village as well as monitoring all schools. We will keep you informed as the police conduct their work. Please do not attempt to come to the schools at this time.

Thank you.
Barbara Duncan

post_text:
There was a report of a possible threat to Indian Hill. Indian Hill is in Lock Down while the police check the building. Due to the nature of the threat, no evacuation was deemed to be necessary. The other schools are in "Secure the Building" until further notce.

We hope to return to normal as soon as possible and I will stay in touch. Please do not come to the schools during this time.
text:

post_text:
All are safe and sound!

W. R. Satz and Holmdel High School have been declared safe and secure. Regular activities have resumed. All after school and evening activities will be in effect.

We appreciate the actions taken by our staff, the Holmdel Police Department and the neighboring police departments to ensure the safety and security of our students and staff.

Thanks to the school community for their cooperation and support during this time.

Regards,

Barbara Duncan
Superintendent
text:
All are safe and sound!

W. R. Satz and Holmdel High School have been declared safe and secure. Regular activities have resumed. All after school and evening activities will be in effect.

We appreciate the actions taken by our staff, the Holmdel Police Department and the neighboring police departments to ensure the safety and security of our students and staff.

Thanks to the school community for their cooperation and support during this time.

Regards,

Barbara Duncan
Superintendent

post_text:
We have a possible swatting incident at Satz. Police are on the scene and all are safe. Satz and the High School are in Lock Down. Village and Indian Hill are in "Secure the Building".
Parents are encouraged to not come to the school buildings. Please stay calm.

post_text:
Based on the latest weather predictions, we are planning for an early dismissal of all Holmdel schools on Monday, 1/26/15. Please plan accordingly and check the district and individual school websites for additional information.

I strongly recommend that student drivers consider leaving their cars at home. Be safe and take the bus!

Stay safe and warm. I will keep you informed as the storm progresses.

Thank you,
Barbara Duncan

post_text:
This is an important weather related announcement for the Holmdel School District. The weather forecast for Holmdel and the surrounding areas calls for potentially significant snow accumulations over the next 48 hours. We are monitoring the forecast closely and may need to adjust and modify our school schedule over the next two days.

Presently, Friday, February 14, 2014 is a scheduled early dismissal for students. Due to the potential of a possible delayed opening for that day, we are changing Friday, February 14, 2014 to a FULL DAY of school.

If it becomes necessary to close schools or have a delayed opening for Thursday, February 13, 2014, you will be contacted by 5:30am Thursday morning. Again, we thank you for your patience and cooperation throughout these weather related conditions
text:

If it becomes necessary to close schools or have a delayed opening for Thursday, February 13, 2014, you will be contacted by 5:30am Thursday morning. Again, we thank you for your patience and cooperation throughout these weather related conditions

post_text: The projected weather forecast for this evening throughout Holmdel and surrounding areas is a snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches ending at approximately 11 pm. We don’t anticipate this current weather condition affecting Monday’s regularly scheduled opening but we will be monitoring conditions throughout this evening and into early Monday morning. If any changes in current conditions warrant a delayed opening or the like, the school community will be notified no later than 5:30 am Monday morning.

post_text: This evening, Governor Christie declared a State of Emergency for Wednesday, 2/5/14. As a result, Holmdel School District will be closed. All after school and evening activities are cancelled as well.
text: This evening, Governor Christie declared a State of Emergency for Wednesday, 2/5/14. As a result, Holmdel School District will be closed. All after school and evening activities are cancelled as well.

post_text:
We will be monitoring the weather and road conditions throughout the night and into the early morning.

If the weather and road conditions call for a delayed opening or school closure, the district will notify the school community by 5:30 am.

Please check our website for all updated information.

Also, consider charging all your electronics and checking batteries in flashlights and fuel levels in generators in the event that icy conditions cause power outages.

We are planning to open our facilities for this weekend. Please check our District website for all updates. http://www.holmdelschools.org
May you have a safe and joyful New Year!

post_text:
Holmdel Township Public Schools will be closed Monday, November 5th and Tuesday, November 6th. There will be no professional development for teachers on November 6th.

Due to the effects of Hurricane Sandy, NJEA has cancelled their convention scheduled for Thursday, November 8th and Friday, November 9th.

If we have power and can open school, we will have classes Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

post_text:
Due to the loss of power and the conditions of our roads, Holmdel Township Schools will be closed Wednesday, October 31st.

We are requesting that all Buildings and Grounds personnel make every effort to come to work. We need your assistance in repairing and addressing any damage caused by the storm.

I will continue to keep you updated.

Stay safe,

Barbara Duncan
Superintendent of Schools
